main event: A silvery light appearing to be about 400 feet in diameter was observed over Gainesville, Florida, moving in an easterly direction on January 13, 1964.
interesting points: The light was yellow-orange in color and flew to the southwest,The object was visible for approximately 15 to 20 seconds,It made no sound and left no trail,The light's characteristics were believed to be too high for a conventional aircraft,Observations were consistent from multiple witnesses including university professors.
sighted object: a silvery light in the sky
witness description: multiple observers including university professors and staff members
